So wait they took away our gun emoji?
text:
Maybe I am crazy, but I distinctly remember there being like a grey pistol emoji, and now all we have is a water gun???

I am literally trying to tell elon musk that it's time to take the neural link out because he just gave a pretty androidian response to the queen's passing, and I want to be like "oh btw this isn't an intervention, and you don't get a choice..." and then when I go to put the pistol emoji, all I see are water pistols now...

What is this? Some funny liberal joke or something?

title: Show HN: A Twitter bot announcing every action of the US Congress
text: Congress quietly released api.congress.gov yesterday, and it seemed natural to make a bot announcing everything either house did, so here one is.

title: Facebook Parent Meta Platforms Cuts Responsible Innovation Team
Ask HN: Dear reseachers/engineers/artists how to practice computer animation?
text:
I am deeply interested in computer animation and simulation. I have basic knowledge of animation, simulation, and modeling. I want to dive deep into the field so that I can catch up with the latest research and trend. Since I want to scale up, I am not able to identify the right keywords to search for. I only find content that is either simple or complex. This clearly means I am lacking practice in the subject.

I would be very thankful if some of you can show me the directions to get started. As a general background: I have an understanding of skeletal animation, FK, IK, motion interpolation, and so on. But I am clueless about how these are implemented in real-time applications. I want to get into crowd simulation, realistic human (quadruped) motion generation, and environment/physics simulation.

Thank you in advance. Have a nice day!
